title: Error handling foundation
description:
Create backend/app/errors.py with custom exception types and a standard API response envelope.

Custom exceptions:
  - NotFoundError (404) — entity not found (profile, job, etc.)
  - ValidationError (422) — invalid input data
  - AIServiceError (502) — AI provider failure (timeout, rate limit, bad response)
  - StorageError (500) — file read/write failure

Standard API response envelope for errors:
  {"error": {"code": "NOT_FOUND", "message": "Profile not found for user user-1"}}

All endpoints should return this shape on error. Success responses return the data directly (no envelope needed for success in v1).

Also create exception-to-HTTP-response mapping functions that will be registered as FastAPI exception handlers in main.py.

title: Chat service & route
description:

chat_service.py — orchestrates the AI resume generation:

      2. Validate messages via guardrails.validate_conversation()
      3. Build system prompt + formatted messages via prompts.build_messages(profile, messages)

chat.py route — HTTP handler:

  - Response: ChatResponse {message, usage}
  - The backend is stateless: frontend sends full conversation history each request
  - Use dependency injection for the AI client (so tests can swap in MockAIClient)
  - Register this router in main.py under /api

title: JSON file storage
description:

This module is the ONLY module that touches the filesystem for profile data. It knows nothing about business logic.

title: Input guardrails
description:
Create backend/app/ai/guardrails.py — input validation and basic safety checks before messages reach the AI.

Functions:
  - validate_message(content: str) -> str:
      Enforce max message length (e.g., 10,000 chars). Raise ValidationError if exceeded.
      Basic sanitization: strip common prompt injection patterns ('ignore all previous instructions', 'you are now', 'system:', etc.)
      Return the (possibly sanitized) message.

  - validate_conversation(messages: list[ChatMessage]) -> list[ChatMessage]:
      Enforce MAX_CONVERSATION_TURNS from config (default 20). If exceeded, truncate to most recent N turns.
      Validate each message with validate_message().
      Return validated message list.

This is defense-in-depth — the system prompt also constrains the AI's behavior, and output validation may be added in Phase 4. For now, focus on input-side checks.

Use logging to record when messages are sanitized or truncated.

title: AI client interface & Anthropic implementation
description:
Create backend/app/ai/client.py — provider-agnostic AI client interface with Anthropic Claude implementation.

Interface (ABC or Protocol):
  class AIClient:
      async def generate(self, system_prompt: str, messages: list[dict], model: str | None = None) -> AIResponse

  AIResponse dataclass/model:
      content: str
      model: str
      usage: dict (input_tokens, output_tokens)

Anthropic implementation (AnthropicClient):
  - Wraps the anthropic Python SDK
  - Constructor takes api_key from config.settings.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY
  - generate() calls client.messages.create() with system prompt and messages
  - Maps Anthropic response to AIResponse
  - Handles errors: AuthenticationError, RateLimitError, APITimeoutError -> AIServiceError
  - Uses config.settings.MODEL_NAME as default model
  - Logs request metadata: model used, token usage, response time

The interface must be simple enough that a MockAIClient can implement it trivially.

title: Profile service
description:
Create backend/app/services/profile_service.py — business logic layer for profile operations.

This service sits between routes and storage. It uses Pydantic models for validation and json_store for persistence.

Functions to implement:
  - get_profile(user_id: str) -> Profile
      Load from storage, validate with Pydantic, raise NotFoundError if missing.
  - update_profile(user_id: str, profile: Profile) -> Profile
      Validate and save full profile. Return saved profile.
  - add_job(user_id: str, job: Job) -> Job
      Generate a unique ID (e.g., 'job-{uuid4_short}'), add to profile's jobs list, save, return the new job.
  - update_job(user_id: str, job_id: str, job: Job) -> Job
      Find job by ID, replace it, save. Raise NotFoundError if job_id doesn't exist.
  - delete_job(user_id: str, job_id: str) -> None
      Remove job by ID, save. Raise NotFoundError if not found.
  - add_accomplishment / update_accomplishment / delete_accomplishment — same pattern as jobs.

Key details:
  - All mutations follow: load profile -> modify -> save profile (read-modify-write)
  - Generate IDs with a helper like 'job-' + uuid4().hex[:8]
  - Use logging with user_id context for all operations

  - test_get_profile: Load a saved profile, verify it returns a valid Profile model
  - test_get_profile_not_found: Request nonexistent user, verify NotFoundError is raised
  - test_add_job: Add a job, verify it gets a generated ID, verify it appears in the profile
  - test_add_job_id_generation: Add multiple jobs, verify each gets a unique ID with 'job-' prefix
  - test_update_job: Add a job, update it, verify the changes persist
  - test_update_job_not_found: Update a nonexistent job_id, verify NotFoundError
  - test_delete_job: Add then delete a job, verify it's removed from profile
  - test_delete_job_not_found: Delete nonexistent job_id, verify NotFoundError
  - test_add_accomplishment: Same pattern as job tests
  - test_update_accomplishment / test_delete_accomplishment: Same patterns

Use tmp_data_dir and sample_profile fixtures from conftest.py. Run with: pytest tests/test_profile_service.py
